page.title: 16QUINTRELL DOWNS
page.content: The{PRINTERS OFFICE}has been in Quintrell Downs since 1972.It was previously a chapel which was built 113 years ago.The printer owns machinery worth up to Â£1500 and his working day starts between 7-00 and 8-30am. Quintrell Inn is 300 years old and ceased brewing its own beer in the early part of this century.Mr Burn the manger sells 600 barrels of beer a year,mostly in the summer when he has to use more staff because of the holiday business. The village is built on a crossroads now converted into a roundabout.This has considerably eased the traffic congestion which occurred particularly in the holiday season where the main road from Summercourt meets the one from Indian Queens.
